author: DOUG FERGUSON
description: The Washington Post is reporting former AT&T Chairman Randall Stephenson has resigned from the PGA Tour policy board.
title: Stephenson resigns from PGA Tour board over 'serious concerns' about Saudi deal, according to report

author: JAKE OFFENHARTZ
description: An influencer-backed energy drink that has earned viral popularity among children is facing scrutiny from lawmakers and health experts over its potentially dangerous levels of caffeine.
title: The FDA is being asked to look into Logan Paul's energy drink, which has the caffeine of 6 Coke cans

author: ERIKA KINETZ
description: Nearly 50,000 Russian soldiers have died in the war in Ukraine, according to a new statistical analysis.
title: How many Russians have died in Ukraine? Data shows what Moscow hides

author: SEUNG MIN KIM
description: President Joe Biden’s itinerary this week in Europe is dominated by the war in Ukraine. But first, he'll have a royal visit with King Charles III at Windsor Castle.
title: After meeting Sunak, Biden heads for Windsor Castle to discuss clean energy with King Charles III

author: MIKE BALSAMO
description: Disgraced sports doctor Larry Nassar has been stabbed multiple times during an altercation with another incarcerated person at a federal prison in Florida.
title: Disgraced sports doctor Larry Nassar stabbed multiple times at Florida federal prison: AP sources

author: HALELUYA HADERO
description: What comes to mind when you hear the phrase Y2K? Here's a hint: It's no longer about a computer glitch that could have made the world go haywire at the end of 1999.
title: Y2K fashion has taken over. And Gen Z is loving it

author: BOBBY CAINA CALVAN
description: Heavy rain has spawned extreme flooding in New York’s Hudson Valley, killing at least one person and forcing road closures.
title: Extreme flooding overwhelms New York roadways and kills 1 person

author: KARL RITTER
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan says his country might approve Sweden’s membership in NATO if European Union nations “open the way” to Turkey’s bid to join the EU.
title: Erdogan says Turkey could approve Sweden's NATO membership if Europeans 'open way' to Turkey EU bid

author: SARA BURNETT
description: As the Republican presidential primary intensifies this summer, most White House hopefuls are devoting their time to events in Iowa and New Hampshire, the states that will kick off the nomination process early next year.
title: Trump and DeSantis begin eyeing Super Tuesday states as they prepare for 2024 long game

author: JAKE BLEIBERG
description: An AP investigation found the sheriff’s turn in the national spotlight belied years of complaints about corruption and dysfunction.
title: Deputies accused a Texas sheriff of corruption and dysfunction. Then came the mass shooting

author: MEG KINNARD
description: Roy Herron, a longtime Tennessee state lawmaker and former chairperson of the state Democratic Party, has died from injuries sustained in a jet ski accident.
title: Roy Herron, longtime Tennessee Democratic lawmaker, dies after injuries from jet ski accident

author: COLLEEN LONG
description: After major blows to his agenda by the Supreme Court, President Joe Biden is intent on making sure voters will have the final say.
title: Stymied by the Supreme Court, Biden wants voters to have the final say on his agenda

author: ARLEIGH RODGERS
description: Families around the US are scrambling to navigate new laws that prohibit their transgender children and teenagers from accessing gender-affirming care.
title: Families with transgender kids are increasingly forced to travel out of state for the care they need

author: TIM REYNOLDS
description: Victor Wembanyama was yelling in celebration, punching the air, even got a Band-Aid on his right cheek because of some physicality.
title: Wembanyama more aggressive in stronger second Summer League game with Spurs in Las Vegas

author: RIO YAMAT
description: A Las Vegas police officer accused of stealing nearly $165,000 in three casino heists is scheduled to face a jury as prosecutors paint him as a gambling addict who grew increasingly desperate under a crush of debt.
title: Las Vegas police officer set to go on trial over $165k stolen in 3 casino heists

author: RONALD BLUM
description: The education of robot umpires has been complicated by an open secret in baseball for the past 150 years: The strike zone called on the field doesn’t match the one mapped out in the rule book.
title: What is a strike in baseball? Robots, rule book and umpires view it differently

author: ELAINE KURTENBACH
description: Wall Street was uneven in early trading as it kicks off a week heavy with corporate earnings and inflation data for the Federal Reserve to consider before its next policy meeting later this month.
title: Stock market today: Wall Street uneven ahead of US inflation update as US earnings season kicks off

author: TIM BOOTH
description: This All-Star week in Seattle was supposed to be Julio Rodríguez’s party, and it still might be. But there's no doubt this season hasn't matched the lofty expecations he and the team had after his sensational rookie year.
title: J-Rod Show gets All-Star stage at home despite challenging second season in majors

author: NOAH TRISTER
description: The Detroit Tigers just picked in the top five of the draft for the fifth time in six years. A couple years ago, the Tigers went 77-85 and looked like they were on the rise.
title: Tigers still waiting for high draft picks to lead to victories

author: JAMES ELLINGWORTH
description: Mercedes driver Lewis Hamilton is happy his old team McLaren is competitive in Formula One again. Even if it is at his expense.
title: Hamilton happy his old team McLaren is competitive again despite losing out for 2nd at British GP

author: author
description: description
title: title

author: Stephen Collinson
description: President Joe Biden said before a critical trip to Europe that Ukraine is not yet ready to enter NATO. More to the point, the alliance is not yet ready for Ukraine to join in a historic step that could deter Moscow but that might also increase the risk of a US-Russia war.
title: Analysis: Why Ukraine's plea for NATO membership is such a profound dilemma for the West | CNN Politics

author: Hande Atay Alam,Christian Edwards
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan said Monday that Brussels should clear the path for Ankara’s accession to the European Union, before his country approves Sweden’s bid for NATO membership.
title: Erdogan ties Sweden's NATO bid to Turkey's path to EU membership | CNN

author: Emiko Jozuka,Marc Stewart,Junko Ogura,Moeri Karasawa,Daniel Campisi
description: Rina Gonoi vowed to bring her alleged tormentors to justice after she says she endured physical and verbal sexual abuse while serving in Japan’s Self-Defense Force.
title: Rina Gonoi dreamed of defending Japan. Instead, her fellow soldiers sexually assaulted her | CNN

author: Shawna Mizelle
description: A top House Republican said Sunday he agreed with the Biden administration’s contentious decision to supply cluster munitions to Ukraine as part of a new military aid package, while a prominent progressive Democrat said the US risks “losing our moral leadership” over the move.
title: Ukraine cluster munitions: A top House Republican supports Biden's decision while a prominent Democrat disagrees | CNN Politics

author: Tara Subramaniam,Manveena Suri
description: Heavy rains brought deadly floods to northern India on the weekend as the country’s capital marked its wettest July day in more than 40 years, according to authorities and local reports.
title: Northern India flooding: New Delhi records wettest July day in decades | CNN

author: Matthew Chance,Mick Krever
description: A train used by Russian President Vladimir Putin to travel away from the public eye has a secret gym, Turkish bath and cosmetology suite on board, a brochure and blueprints leaked to the Dossier Center and shared with CNN reveal.
title: Putin's 'ghost' train: Leaked documents reveal gym, spa, beauty equipment on board | CNN

author: Sarah Sirgany,Kostyantin Gak,Ben Wedeman
description: In the frontline town of Siversk, eastern Ukraine, residents are surviving but life in wartime isn’t easy. Roughly 1,000 people hold on to their homes and lead a pale semblance of the lives they once had there.
title: Residents cling on to life in Ukrainian frontline town | CNN

author: Jessie Yeung,Yoonjung Seo,Paula Hancocks
description: In many supermarkets across South Korea, one item has conspicuously vanished from shelves: salt.
title: Fukushima wastewater: South Korean shoppers hoard salt, seafood ahead of Japan's release of treated radioactive water | CNN Business

author: Nadeen Ebrahim
description: Its annual conferences have attracted the who’s-who of right-wing and hawkish, conservative politicians from the West, including former US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo, former United States National Security Adviser John Bolton and ex-Vice President Mike Pence.
title: A darling of US conservatives, Iran's top opposition group may face an uncertain future | CNN

author: Jessie Yeung
description: Six people have been killed and one injured in an early morning knife attack outside a kindergarten in southern China, according to Lianjiang city police and Chinese state-run media.
title: China knife attack outside kindergarten leaves six dead in Lianjiang | CNN

author: Chris Lau
description: A restaurant in China that challenged its customers to eat more than 100 dumplings in return for a free meal has fallen foul of authorities, who are investigating whether it has violated the country’s anti-food waste law.
title: Authorities swoop on Chinese restaurant that challenged customers to eat 108 dumplings | CNN

author: Dan Heching
description: The cast of new comedy “Joy Ride” was in for a treat on Friday, when legendary comic and actor Amy Schumer surprised them during their press tour in Miami.
title: Amy Schumer surprises cast of 'Joy Ride,' praises their film as the 'comedy of the summer' | CNN

author: Amy Cassidy,Nimi Princewill
description: The United Nations has warned that Sudan could be on the verge of all-out-war after a weekend airstrike killed dozens in a residential area in the Sudanese city of Omdurman.
title: UN warns of 'full-scale civil war' in Sudan after weekend airstrike kills dozens | CNN

author: Mitchell McCluskey,Niamh Kennedy,Chris Liakos
description: The BBC has suspended “a male member of staff” following allegations of sexual misconduct. UK tabloid The Sun first reported Friday that a woman had accused an unnamed male BBC presenter of paying her teen child for sexually explicit photographs.
title: BBC suspends presenter following sexual misconduct allegations | CNN

author: Catherine Nicholls,Christian Edwards
description: Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte said Monday he would step down as leader of the country’s ruling party and leave politics, after his government collapsed over immigration policy, Dutch national broadcaster and CNN affiliate NOS reported.
title: Dutch PM Mark Rutte to leave politics after government collapses | CNN

author: Chris Isidore
description: Former AT&T CEO Randall Stephenson has resigned from his post on the influential policy board of the PGA Tour in protest to the proposed merger with Saudi-backed LIV Golf.
title: PGA Tour board member Randall Stephenson quits over deal with LIV Golf | CNN Business

author: George Ramsay
description: Belarusian tennis player Victoria Azarenka said “it wasn’t fair” that the Wimbledon crowd booed the end of her fourth-round match against Ukrainian Elina Svitolina.
title: Wimbledon: Belarusian Victoria Azarenka says it ‘wasn’t fair’ to be booed after facing Ukrainian Elina Svitolina | CNN

author: Jeremy Herb
description: President Joe Biden told CNN in an exclusive interview that Ukraine is not yet ready for NATO membership, saying that Russia’s war in Ukraine needs to end before the alliance can consider adding Kyiv to its ranks.
title: CNN Exclusive: Biden says war with Russia must end before NATO can consider membership for Ukraine | CNN Politics

author: Luke McGee
description: NATO officials are in a race against time to avoid the embarrassment of seeing the alliance miss its own stated aim of admitting Sweden to the alliance by July 11.
title: NATO Turkey: Alliance is in a race against time to save itself from a major embarrassment | CNN

author: Chris Lau
description: An explosion at a chemical plant in Southeast China on Saturday sent huge billows of thick black smoke into the air.
title: Jiangxi: Explosion at chemical factory in China | CNN
